intro: Selago micradenia, commonly known as the small-leaved selago, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and produces white or pinkish flowers in clusters. It typically grows in heathland and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Selago micradenia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate poor soil conditions.
